<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 2+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Book of Translation](/Equipment.aspx?ID=858)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [PFS Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=50) pg. 92</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The book is leather-bound and decorated with the symbol of the Lantern Lodge. Red and gold cords wrap around the book and tie to keep it shut. Each volume offers translation for a different language. When working with a book of translation, you can attempt [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) checks to [Gather Information](/Actions.aspx?ID=49) or to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) with creatures that speak the language featured in the book, even if you do not speak the language. Such checks take 10 times longer to complete and you take a –2 circumstance penalty to the check due to your limited communication capabilities.

</column>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Price** 125 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

An advanced book of translation features more complex phrases, local colloquialisms, and assumes a rudimentary understanding of the featured language. Checks attempted while using an advanced book of translation do not take a circumstance penalty.
